snippet: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, plans on Tuesday to propose an overhaul of gifted and talented programs that would provide space for more children and loosen admissions requirements.
abstract: New York City Council Speaker Christine Quinn plans to propose a significant overhaul of gifted and talented programs that would provide space for more children and loosen admissions requirements; Democratic candidate for mayor will call on city officials to double the number of schools for high-performing children and add slots to existing programs, creating 8,700 new seats over nine years.
lead_paragraph: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, plans on Tuesday to propose an overhaul of gifted and talented programs that would provide space for more children and loosen admissions requirements.

headline.seo: Quinn Proposes a Plan to Add Slots and Schools for Gifted Students
headline.main: Quinn Offers Plan to Add Slots for Gifted in City Schools
headline.print_headline: Quinn Offers Plan to Add Slots for Gifted In City Schools
